title: Swayman: Team USA ‘should have reacted differently’ to Trump’s joke about US women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman, Bruins goalie, expressed regret over men's team's reaction to Trump's joke about U.S. women's hockey team.
During Olympic celebration, Trump joked about inviting women's team; several men's players laughed, later expressing regret.
The U.S. women's hockey team declined Trump's White House invitation, citing previous commitments despite acknowledgment.

title: MSPCA-Angell evacuates nearly 50 animals, opens shelter to pets from Cape homes without power
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MSPCA-Angell evacuated nearly 50 animals from its Cape Cod shelter due to power outages and fuel shortages.
Evacuated animals, including cats, dogs, and rodents, were relocated to MSPCA locations in Nevins Farm and Boston.
The Cape Cod shelter now offers temporary housing for pets from homes still without power after the nor’easter.

title: A small town arts scene in Vermont is among the best in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Stowe, Vermont named No. 9 in USA Today's 2026 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards for small town arts scenes.
Stowe offers vibrant arts with galleries and Spruce Peak Arts hosting music, dance, theater, and comedy events.
Stowe Foliage Arts Festival runs Oct. 9-11, coinciding with the autumn foliage, enhancing town's cultural appeal.

title: Not in Boston? Your space saver is likely illegal
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Most Massachusetts cities and towns, excluding Boston, ban space savers, with fines up to $100 for violations.
Boston allows space savers during snow emergencies, except in Bay Village and South End, enforcing a 48-hour limit post-emergency.
Cambridge, Somerville, Malden, Medford, and Brookline strictly enforce space saver bans, emphasizing parking fairness.

title: ESPN insider has Roman Anthony ranked among MLB’s top-10 corner outfielders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Roman Anthony ranked No. 7 among MLB corner outfielders by ESPN's Buster Olney.
Anthony had a .396 on-base percentage as a rookie; praised by Chipper Jones and former GM JP Ricciardi.
Manager Alex Cora plans to keep Anthony as Red Sox's leadoff hitter despite debate over his best fielding position.

title: Where do you get a meal for under $20 in Malden?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks recommendations for meals under $20 in Malden to guide diners on budget-friendly options.
Malden offers diverse cuisine, including American barbecue, Asian food, Ethiopian dishes, and worker-owned cafes.
Readers can submit meal recommendations via a form or email to potentially be featured in a future dining guide.

title: The story behind this viral photo of an unplowed Fall River street
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Snow removal lagging in Fall River as only a fifth of streets were plowed after a major blizzard.
June Street residents express frustration with the city's slow snow removal and lack of equipment.
Mayor Paul Coogan cites snowstorm's impact and depleted resources as challenges for timely plowing.

title: The ultra-rare Honus Wagner card with local ties just sold for a world-record-breaking amount
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A 1909 Honus Wagner baseball card, long held by the Shields family, sold for $5.12 million through Goldin auctions.
The card, graded PSA 1, set a record for its condition, surpassing the previous high sale by $2 million.
The card was originally acquired in Taunton and remained undiscovered by collectors until recently highlighted in a Netflix series.

title: ICE deportees reportedly held on N.H. tarmac for more than 12 hours during storm
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: A flight carrying around 100 ICE detainees was grounded at Portsmouth International Airport for over 30 hours during a winter storm.
Detainees were held on the plane for 13 hours before being allowed into a terminal at Portsmouth International Airport.
ICE ensured detainees had access to food, water, restrooms, and medical care during delays caused by a blizzard.

title: Reggie Miller: Celtics are ‘scariest’ team in the East with or without Jayson Tatum
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference, winning nine of their last 10 games without Jayson Tatum.
Reggie Miller considers the Celtics the 'scariest' team in the East, highlighting Jaylen Brown as a fringe MVP candidate.
Celtics excel defensively, holding opponents to a league-best 107.6 points per game and ranking seventh in defensive rating.
